an4.166:4.1: “Mendicants, there are four ways of practice.
an4.166:4.3: ~Painful practice with slow insight, ~painful practice with swift insight, ~pleasant practice with slow insight, and ~pleasant practice with swift insight.
an4.166:5.1: Of these, the painful practice with slow insight is considered inferior on both accounts:
an4.166:5.4: This practice is considered inferior on both accounts.
an4.166:6.1: The painful practice with swift insight is considered inferior because it’s painful.
an4.166:7.1: The pleasant practice with slow insight is considered inferior because it’s slow.
an4.166:8.1: The pleasant practice with swift insight is considered inferior on both accounts:
an4.166:8.4: This practice is considered superior on both accounts.
an4.166:8.5: These are the four ways of practice.”
